work-experience.job-description: Supported  game   content   management   through  the   development   of   new   web-based  tools   and  services.   New   applications   allowed  for  the   tracking,  analyzing,  and  transforming  of   game   assets   through  a   web   browser.      Assisted  in  the   designing  and  development   of   a   web  platform   for  content   management;   mitigated  tracking  utilities   and  their  related  log  files   to  a   web-accessible   portal.      Provided  new   asset   tracking  utilities   by  leveraging  the   Akamai   Game   Distribution  framework.      Oversaw   the   migration  and  archiving  of   Rosetta   Stone's   older  language   software   and  media.     IBM,   Research   Triangle   Park,   North   Carolina   Automation   Engineer,   Co-op                          August   2010      December   2010

Using  the   Rational   Functional   Tester  and  Selenium   frameworks,  developed  and  maintained  Java-based  test   automation  for  the   Lotus   Quickr  platform.  The   provided  automation  simplified  and  eased  the   process   of   regressively  testing  new   builds   by  automating  user  interaction.      Served  in  Agile-managed  teams   of   four,  providing  Continuous   Integration  of   new   test   automation  into  the   Quickr  life   cycle.      Implemented  new   Java   frameworks   for  the   discovery,  navigation,  and  management   of   HTML   web  components      doubling  automation  reliability  and  decreasing  run  time   by  roughly  10%.      Applied  new   build  and  self-testing  automation  scripts,  allowing  incoming  revisions   to  be   tested  automatically  and  without   the   need  for  developer  supervision.       Academic   Experience   Hartwood   Elementary   School,   Virginia   iPhone   Game   Development                                             January   2010     May   2010

As   part   of   a   state   sponsored  study  in  learning  technology,  developed  a   set   of   education-based  games   for  the   iPhone   and  iPod  Touch.  Worked  closely  with  Hartwood  Elementary  staff   in  Fredericksburg,  Virginia   throughout   development,  specifically  focusing  on  grades   K-3.  Ultimate   goal   of   project   was   to  improve   Hartwood's   performance   on  standardized  state   tests.      Designed  and  produced  two  math  and  reading  comprehension-focused  games.  Provided  and  integrated  everything  from   the   game   mechanics   to  the   games'   media   and  assets.      Final   project   received  a   $5,000  grant   from   the   Pepsi   Refresh  Project   and  was   featured  in  several   local   publications.     University   of   Mary   Washington,   Virginia   Visualization  Techniques   in  Java  3D                       August   2009      December   2009

Designed   and   implemented   a   Java   Swing-based  application  to  test   the   versatility  of   Oracle's   Java   3D   API  while   developing  new   techniques   in  data   visualization.  Under  the   supervision  of   a   department   professor,  created  and  deployed  a   3D   model   of   the   Mary  Washington  campus   to  serve   as   a   canvas   for  organizing  and  displaying  assorted  sets   of   data.      Designed  and  implemented  an  application  in  Swing  to  test   the   versatility  of   Sun's   Java   3D   API  while   developing  new   techniques   in  data   visualization.      Created  and  deployed  a   3D   recreation  of   the   Mary  Washington  campus,  using  it   to  visually  organize   and  display  the   breakup  of   majors   at   our   university.
